titleInfo.title: John B. Brownlow in Washington, D.C. to O.P. Temple in Knoxville, Tennessee

mods.note: Brownlow gives Temple the address of the Pennsylvania hotel used by Andrew Johnson as boarding house and discusses the location at length. Discusses the arbitrary and unwarrented eulogism encountered within the United States Congress. Expresses frustration with the ommission of Temple`s name as a top leader in East Tennessee Unionism. Mentions Temple`s book. Urges Temple to apply to the Sons of the American Revolution.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
